abstract: Bangkok appears to have successfully prevented monsoon flooding with wall of sandbags, allaying fears of many residents, but the northern provinces have been hit by diverted pocket of floodwater; many Thais are angry that their own homes have been sacrificed for sake of the capital; flooding has been worst in Thailand in at least half a century.
snippet: By building a wall of sandbags to spare the low-lying Thai capital, in the delta of the country’s main river system, officials have sacrificed the provinces to the north.
lead_paragraph: By building a wall of sandbags to spare the low-lying Thai capital, in the delta of the country’s main river system, officials have sacrificed the provinces to the north.

headline.main: Floodwalls Keep Bangkok Dry but Provinces Angry
headline.print_headline: Floodwalls Keep Bangkok Dry but Provinces Angry
